Route 302 runs through the middle of the village from the state line with New Hampshire just a mile away.  From Portland, take Route 302 west for approximately 50 miles.  Other routes in include Route 5 coming down from Bethel to the north.
Fryeburg has its own airport serving western Maine and eastern New Hampshire -

value: http://www.airnav.com/airport/IZG Eastern Slopes Regional Airport - KIZG

. Fryeburg is also a one-hour drive from Portland Airport, which serves more commercial flights.

provides natural sandy beaches that promote swimming, kayaking, and canoeing.
address=Fair Season: 1154 Main Street, Fryeburg, ME 04037; Off-Season: P.O. Box 78, Fryeburg, ME 04037
price=$10 per person; seniors over 65 free on Tuesday; prices for rides, food, etc. vary.
content=The Fryeburg Fair, hosted from late September to early October, is a traditional fair with rides, performances, livestock, food, crafts, and of course, a midway.
content=(Rt. 113N). Romantic B&B with six comfortable rooms.

content= Located on a quiet residential street away from the main road but in the heart of the village, this quiet, upscale B&B is a great place to use as a base for your explorations of the region. 7 Guest rooms, all with private baths, air-conditioning and WI-FI, some with whirlpool and fireplace. Spacious grounds, lots of Guest common areas and fantastic breakfasts included in the rate.
